searchQueries.title: Search queries
searchQueries.description: Queries to search LinkedIn posts. The same query as you would use in the LinkedIn search bar.

postedLimit.title: Posted Limit (filter)
postedLimit.description: Fetch posts no older than X time. Options: '24h', 'week', 'month'.

authorUrls.title: Profile or Company URLs who posted
authorUrls.description: List of LinkedIn profile or company URLs to scrape. Example: `https://www.linkedin.com/in/williamhgates` will fetch posted or re-posted content by Bill Gates.

authorsCompanies.title: Companies where authors work
authorsCompanies.description: Scrape posts of profile-authors who assigned to LinkedIn Company Names of these companies. Example: `Google` will fetch posts of Google employees or ex-employees in some cases.

maxPosts.title: Maximum number of posts to scrape per each search query (overrides pagination)
maxPosts.description: Maximum number of posts to scrape per each search query. This overrides pagination. If you set this to 0, it will scrape all posts.

maxReactions.title: Maximum number of reactions to scrape per post
maxReactions.description: Maximum number of reactions to scrape per post. Default is 5.

maxComments.title: Maximum number of comments to scrape per post
maxComments.description: Maximum number of comments to scrape per post. Default is 5.

authorsCompanyUrls.title: Author's Company URLs
authorsCompanyUrls.description: Scrape posts of profile-authors who assigned to LinkedIn URL of these companies. Example: `https://www.linkedin.com/company/google` will fetch posts of Google employees or ex-employees in some cases.

authorsCompanyPublicIdentifiers.title: Author's Company Public Identifiers (last part in the URL)
authorsCompanyPublicIdentifiers.description: Scrape posts of profile-authors who assigned to LinkedIn Public Identifiers of these companies. Example: `google` will fetch posts of Google employees or ex-employees in some cases.

authorsCompanyIds.title: Author's LinkedIn Company IDs
authorsCompanyIds.description: Scrape posts of profile-authors who assigned to LinkedIn Company IDs of these companies. Example: `1441` will fetch posts of Google employees or ex-employees in some cases.

profileUrls.title: Profile URLs
profileUrls.description: List of LinkedIn profile URLs to scrape. Example: `https://www.linkedin.com/in/williamhgates` will fetch posted or re-posted content by Bill Gates.

profilePublicIdentifiers.title: Profile Public Identifiers (last part in the URL)
profilePublicIdentifiers.description: List of LinkedIn Public Identifiers. Example: `williamhgates` will fetch posted or re-posted content by Bill Gates.

profileIds.title: LinkedIn Profile IDs
profileIds.description: List of LinkedIn profile IDs to scrape.  Example: `ACoAAA8BYqEBCGLg_vT_ca6mMEqkpp9nVffJ3hc`.

companyUrls.title: Company URLs
companyUrls.description: List of LinkedIn company URLs to scrape. Example: `https://www.linkedin.com/company/google`.

companyPublicIdentifiers.title: Company Public Identifiers (last part in the URL)
companyPublicIdentifiers.description: List of LinkedIn Public Identifiers. Example: `google`.

companyIds.title: LinkedIn Company IDs
companyIds.description: List of LinkedIn company IDs to scrape. Example: `1441`.

scrapePages.title: Number of pages to scrape
scrapePages.description: Number of pages to scrape from the profile. Default is 1. Page size is about 20 posts.

page.title: Page number to start scraping from
page.description: Page number to start scraping from. Default is 1. Page size is about 20 posts.
